page.title: 07LANDRAKE VILLAGE HALL-USE
page.content: 1931 Trust Deed governs hall provided for recreational and intellectual development of Landrake.Parish Council Trustees.Hall managed by committee of five members elected by parish and representatives of village organisations using it,currently Church,Chapel,Badminton Club,Women's Institute,Amateur Dramatics Society, Larrick Club (over sixties),Mothers & Toddlers,Play Group,Young Farmers Club,Working Mens Club & Carnival committee. Hall is also used for doctors surgeries,bingo,whist drives and occasionally wedding parties, dances,bazaars,drama,etc. Additionally as fund raiser,teams of about 14 from village organisations serve breakfasts 0600 to 0930 to A38 tourists on eleven summer Saturdays.1985 charge for village organisations regular sessions in main hall Â£4.75.
